page.title: 15LANDSCAPE AROUND HARDWICK
page.content: This flat area rising from 135' to 183'has wide views of skies,unfenced arable fields,& smaller hedged grazing meadows,crossed by narrow sometimes winding lanes.There is a 70 acre wood,some spinneys small greens & numerous old moats & ditches joining farms & a source of the River Tas. Hardwick street has 16 council homes houses of various ages,PostOffice/shop a tin Village Hall &flintfaced Church. Around are scattered hamlets & farms. Older houses are timber framed,with lathe & plaster or clay lump or brick, with tiles & occasional thatch.About 30 farmhouses & 6 barns are listed Grade2.Victorian pairs of cottages & detached houses are of brick,as are modern houses & bungalows.These well kept homes have gardens & garages. Barns are made of wood,brick,steel or concrete blocks & asbestos.
